intro: Elephantopus scaber var. coeruleus, commonly known as blue elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
